are served by a daily overnight train and a twice weekly daytime local train that runs west on Thursdays and Sundays and east on Mondays and Fridays.  A local train may leave
for Santa Clara (very) early in the morning, returning in the evening.  Another local train may travel from

Santa Clara has an international airport named Abel Santa Maria. This airport is used mostly by tourists who are going to all inclusives resorts in Cayo Santa Maria. Air Canada, Air Transat, Canjet, Wesjet and Cubana serve many Canadian cities from this airport
Horse carriages operate in the centre of town and can take you to Che's mausoleum for around 1 CUC

value: File:Che Guevara Image on a Hill, Santa Clara.jpg
Che Guevara Image on a Hill

Santa Clara contains the mausoleum for the fallen of the Revolution. Included in this mausoleum is Che Guevara himself. In order to maintain the sanctity of the place, photography inside the mausoleum is strictly prohibited. Also, there are no souvenir-sellers to be found nearby. There is also a Che Guevara museum, as well as a huge square (Plaza de la Revolucion) overlooked by a large statue of Che. Americans are, unofficially at least,
inside the museum and mausoleum, although the don't ask for ID; just where you're from, so mention that you're Canadian, Irish, etc. if you're American
File:Tren Blindado memorial in Santa Clara (inside park).jpg

5/10 minutes east of the center is the "Monumento a la Toma del Tren Blindado" - the site of one of the most important battles in Cuban history, where Che Guevara and his men ripped up the railway line, derailing an armoured train, and defeated the men inside. The site shows the actual bulldozer used, and a number of the actual train carriages in situ. Inside the carriages are exhibits, with accompanying text, in Spanish only.
The Constantino Perez cigar factory is a working factory in Santa Clara open for visitors.
content=Has decent pizza. Internet access 5 CUC

Cafes and cantinas are located in one section of 'Main Street' (listen for the live music) where the usual
abound. In fact, a real treat is the ridiculously cheap and fantastically fresh and tasty espresso located on the strip.

content=Beautiful old casa overlooking the central square in Santa Clara City. Welcoming family. Breakfast included, other meals available.
address=Calle Maestra Nicolasas (Candelaria) No. 74 e/ Colon y Maceo, Santa Clara, Cuba
content=Two rooms with private bath, hot water, air conditioning, meals available. Really nice family! The teenage boy and girl speak English
